    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    Action
    Describes actions of games.
    ActionTask
    Calls the Player.getAction(List, long[]) method of the player that was set in and returns its result and measures the elapsed time in nanoseconds.
    BoardGameCanvas
    Specifies the background painting by drawing a grid on the canvas and handles mouse and keyboard interactions.
    ColoredObject
    Represents a colored UI object.
    ConstructionTask<R>
    Constructs the specified type of object calling the constructor was set with the parameters were set and measures the elapsed time in nanoseconds.
    Direction
    Represents the action of the MarioGame
    Drawable
    Defines the functions have to be implemented for a game that has gui.
    DummyPlayer
    Used for replay mode.
    Engine
     
    EventListener
    Event listener helper class for the GUI.
    FilledOvalObject
    Represents a filled oval UI object.
    FilledRectangleObject
    Represents a filled rectangle UI object.
    Game<P,A>
    Describes games for the specified type of player and action.
    GameCanvas
    Represents the canvas of a game, that is the inner side of the window.
    GameFrame
    This class handles the frame of the GUI.
    GameObject
    GUI related class.
    HumanPlayer
    Used for manual controlled Mario only with GUI.
    Mario
    Represents the Mario of the MarioGame
    MarioCanvas
    Canvas for the MarioGame.
    MarioGame
    A very simplified implementation of the classical Mario game.
    MarioPlayer
    Abstract class the specifies a player of the MarioGame
    MarioState
    Represents the state of the MarioGame
    Pair<F,S>
    Represents a pair of the specified type of objects.
    Player<A>
    Describes players of the games and the type of actions, can be performed.
    RandomPlayer
    Takes a random action every time.
    RightUpPlayer
    Randomly chooses MarioGame.RIGHT or MarioGame.UP action.
    StringBufferOutputStream
    Output stream that writes into the specified buffer.
    TimeOutTask<R>
    Measures the elapsed time of a function that returns the specified type of object.
    Utils
    Class for utility functions.
